content.question: In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, two points are close together on the graph of an implicitly defined function. The graph includes these two points and a vertical line segment connecting them. Which of the following is true?

choices.label: The rate of change of <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> is positive on the portion of the graph between the two points.
The rate of change of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> is positive on the portion of the graph between the two points.

The rate of change of <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> is <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math> on the portion of the graph between the two points.

The rate of change of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> is <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math> on the portion of the graph between the two points.

content.answer: The rate of change of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> with respect to <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> is <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math> on the portion of the graph between the two points.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
